definition: lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
seven/7
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: By the time we arrived an hour late she was fuming.
sentences.chinese: 我们晚到了一小时，她正气得七窍生烟。

sentences.english: By the time we arrived an hour later she was fuming with rage.
sentences.chinese: 我们晚到了一个小时，她正气得七窍生烟。

sentences.english: After having to wait nearly an hour and a half, she was foaming.
sentences.chinese: 等了将近一个半小时之后，她气得七窍生烟。

sentences.english: Sir Walter promptly boxed his son's ears.
sentences.chinese: 老沃特闻言七窍生烟，立马甩了他儿子一个耳光。

sentences.english: He foamed with anger over the matter.
sentences.chinese: 这件事气得他七窍生烟。

sentences.english: When she heard he would come again, she fumed with anger.
sentences.chinese: 一听说他又要来，她七窍生烟。

definition: to get angry/to fume
to get really angry
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to abuse roundly
red in the face/extremely angry
to get angry/to burn with rage
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
angry/indignant
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
to burst with rage/to blow one's top
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
torrent of abuse (idiom)
to be annoyed/to get angry
